intro: Lepidosperma tetraquetrum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedgeland sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Lepidosperma tetraquetrum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
